questions.question: [a] From the perspective of a language expert, what was unusual about Singlish?

choices.answer: It has incessant humid heat.
Its tone is very low and difficult to understand.
It is mostly sluggish with Dixie drawl, but sometimes it is dynamic.
It is unconventional and quirky.

questions.question: [b] According to the writer, why did Singlish develop?

choices.answer: Immigrants of New York and Texas affected each other strongly.
The government critized early Singaporean to use the same language.
Languages of Malay, China, and Indian intertwined due to stormy history.
In the early 19C, Singlish came from nowhere.
Different Asian dialects influenced each other and also English of the U.K.
There has been a concret stages of the language development.
Rules and pronunciation were taught by English teachers.
Dialects of Malay, China, and Indian soon disappeared in the country.

questions.question: [d] What were the two features of spoken Singlish that the writer noticed?

choices.answer: rules of English grammar / words from Hokkien, Malay, & Indian
rules of Chinese grammar / words from Hokkien, Malay, & Korea
rules of Chinese grammar / words from Hokkien, Malay, and Indian
rules of Malay grammar / words from Hokkien, Indonesians, Muslim

questions.question: [e] In what ways in the grammar of written Singlish different to standard English?

choices.answer: complex phrases are promoted, and verbs are inserted
verbs are inserted, and marks of 'the', plurality, tenses and voices are op
complex phrases are neglected, and verbs are omitted
marks of 'the', plurality, tenses and voices are mandatory

questions.question: [g] Why is there no single variety of Singlish?

choices.answer: Due to the colorful and unique culture
Due to the influences of various mother tongues
Due to a short tongues that they have
Due to the machine-sun speed of the language

questions.question: [h] Why does the Singapore government criticize the use of Singlish?

choices.answer: to promote the country's image of a trade hub
to admonish bad Singaporean children
to boost the development of the city
to avoid complex phrases of Singlish

questions.question: [i] How do educated Singaporeans use Singlish?

choices.answer: They stick to the unconventional English.
They convert from Singlish to standard English, and backand forth.
They only use the Queen's English.
They only talk with Kakaotalk

questions.question: [i-2] How do less educated citizens of Singapore use Singlish?

choices.answer: They try to speak standard English as possible
They switch smoothly from Singlish to standard English
They cling to grammatically and phonetically unique language
They don't like to talk very much

questions.question: [j] What is the writer's overall view of Singlish?

choices.answer: Singlish is one of the broken Englishes
Singlish is  the last building block of the Asian languages
Singlish is something that Singaporeans bemoan
Singlish is unique and distinct legacy of the country
